name: Sheraton Suites Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton Suites is a comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Although it is away from the busy tourist attractions, the hotel offers free hourly shuttle service to town. The suites are large and the bathroom has a six foot walk-in shower. There is a flat screen TV in the bedroom and a regular TV in the living room. The pool is large enough and seemed to be well maintained.
reviews.title: A Comfortable Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Nice pool and proximity to the beach

reviews.text: All of the hotel staff were friendly, but our favorite person was Dottie the weekend concierge who helped us choose a snorkeling excursion and a kayak trip. She seemed to genuinely care that her guests pick just the right excursions.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, nice staff

likes.liked: — Very pet friendly - all of Key West is as well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before the trip, I had seen reviews that complained about late service by cleaning staff, but our room was promptly cleaned every morning before we left for the day's activities.
reviews.title: first impressions aren't everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side was the limited menu in the hotel's only restaurant. Again, the staff were friendly and efficient, but how could a resort hotel have only four entrees on the menu? The breakfast buffet was a little pricey, but had good food, and it was more economical than ordering a la carte.
reviews.title: Good deal for a Key West BEACH experience.

likes.liked: — Convenience to beach w/o hassle of downtown hooplah
likes.disliked: — Having to cross sometimes busy street to get to beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was a comfortable stay, and we would not hesitate to book here again.
reviews.title: Nice property, but worn out and in need of updating.

likes.disliked: — The entire property needs to be updated... it looked worn.

reviews.text: We took our bikes, and the Sheraton has hourly shuttles downtown...so distance was a non-issue.
reviews.title: Quite pleased with my stay

reviews.text: The beach is very nice for what it is. It's not a Panhandle quality beach, but it's nice.
reviews.title: Great Family Resort in Key West!!!!

likes.liked: — The Suites wre huge and lay out perfectly for famlies with children
likes.disliked: — not a great concierge, had few reccomendations that were family friendly

reviews.text: The room was very nice for the money. King bed, fold out sofa, huge bathroom and shower, fridge, microwave, sink, etc etc.... all the stuff you'd expect in a suite. Flat panel TV was a nice touch!
reviews.title: Quiet & nice but a bit boring
Relaxing Key West Vacation
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice. The suite was large and the bed was very comfortable. We especially enjoyed the spacious bathroom and large shower. There was also plenty of storage space. The peanut butter cookies offered at check-in are marvelous!! I have been searching everywhere online for the recipe and cannot find it :( I would love to be able to duplicate those cookies!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ocean front and a suite. It had everything you would need to enjoy your time away from home. A short walk across the stree to the beach where you can rent chairs to sit in for the day. The water had a lot of seaweed when we were there. Not sure if it is always like that. The pool area seemed small, but was always enough for the people that were there for our stay. The outside bar serves food and can be eatten at the pool. The service was excellent. The free shuttle was a huge plus. We tried to drive into town one night and would not go through that hassle again when you could just hop on the shuttle.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Our suite on the 3rd floor was beautiful and generously spacious. Our room overlooked the courtyard but that didn't take away from it at all. The bedroom and bathroom were more than enough space for 2 of us and could easily be enough to accommodate and additional 2 guests on the sofa sleeper, located in the living area.
reviews.title: Amazing suites, just too close to the airport.

reviews.text: Guest services were receptive and more than pleasant. Located just across from a beach, had the weather cooperated more, this would've been a great beach to relax on. Unfortunately, we arrived on a day that had record rainfall, 4 inches in about 4 hours. That said, the streets flooded and stayed flooded. Shuttles run every 30 minutes from early morning until 11:15 at night to Duval Street...and the driver was pleasant and very knowledgable about hot spots in the area.
reviews.title: Super Awesome A+

reviews.text: The only downfall, not really Sheraton's fault, is the construction going on nearby and the airport is about 1/2 mike away, so you get flyby noise from the beach. The pool was cool and clean, and we even had a quick visit from a colorful 3 foot long iguana ( the guest kids enjoyed.)
reviews.title: Exactly what you expect from a Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a clean and an excellent place to stay. It is right across the street from the beach and just minutes from Duval Street where all the action is located. Although, the beach directly across the street is not the best in Key West. The hotel is still a great spot.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — It was clean and the people were nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a week in Key West, and we stayed in the Sheraton Suites. It is a nice place, the rooms are great, very clean spacious suites, the staff is very accomodating. We looked at a lot of different places in Key West before our trip, and this was relatively inexpensive compared to some of the other places on the island. This does not mean it is lacking in any service, just the location is off the beaten path.
reviews.title: good hotel - great rooms!

likes.disliked: — lack of response to request for minor maintainence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay at the Sheraton Suites, you cannot walk to most of the KW main attractions, restaurants, etc. Mallory Square, Duval St, Whitehead St. to get to any of them you will have to drive, take a taxi, or rent a moped. One note, we read a lot of reviews on this site about lack of parking in downtown Key West. There is actually no FREE parking, there is lots of parking to be found, as long as you don't mind paying $10 per day, which is still cheaper than a cab. The Sheraton does offer a hourly free shuttle to downtown but it is limited to 16 people each hour and you have to get a ticket beforehand. It fills up quickly, you should probably get your tickets the day before to ensure a spot.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: The Front desk staff and the Concierge staff are extremely helpful. The only glitch was that when we first checked in we were given a room that was in the back of the hotel, view of the parking lot, and it was an extremely long walk from the car to the elevator, and then another long walk to the room. We went back to the desk and requested a room closer to an elevator, and they quickly changed our room, to one closer to an elevator.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but more attention to detail needed

reviews.text: The pool area is very nice, it got a little crowded in the afternoon, but there were always at least a few chairs and umbrellas available. The bar overlooking the pool was just what you would expect, lots of tropical frozen drinks to be had, and friendly bartenders.
reviews.title: An excellent Ernest Miller H. place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Sheraton. We picked this spot because it is on the quieter side of Key West. There is a beach right across the street. The street is a 4 lane road, and at times can get pretty busy.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation
Wonderful resort!
reviews.text: The rooms here are very nice and clean. The rooms are pretty big, and they really are suites with doors that close between the bedroom and the living room/kitchen area. There is a fridge in the kitchen area. There is a coffee maker in the kitchen area. The coffee maker brews one cup at a time, and you get three packets of coffee each day – 2 regular and 1 decaf. There are not a lot of breakfast options. The first day we bought coffee from the coffee bar – we wanted some sort of breakfast pastry too, but there didn’t seem to be any available – we didn’t see any, and the person who poured our coffee for us was also waiting on tables in the restaurant, so he was pretty busy. The two cups of coffee were $7 – so I suggest making the coffee in your room, since there is no extra charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom is marble with a pretty big shower. There is a safe in the bathroom. The bathroom products are of good quality, and our housekeeper left two bottles of everything for us to ensure that we would not run out. There is a door tag that you can fill out to select the time the housekeeping staff cleans your room. Unfortunately we didn’t see this until the day we were checking out.
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay at the Shearton Keys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is small for the size of the hotel. I’m guessing that people generally go to the beach, but while we were there the wind was very strong and causing a sand storm, so I think that is why the pool was so crowded.
reviews.title: romantic anniversary

reviews.text: We took the free shuttle into town each day. It is about a 10 minute ride. While we were there the shuttle was picking up at the hotel at 30 minutes past each hour from 9:30 in the morning until 10:30 at night. The shuttle would pick up in town at 50 minutes past each hour from 9:50 in the morning until 10:50 at night. There was only one time where there were too many passengers for the bus that we encountered. I think the bus driver ended up making an extra run – but I am not sure, since I was able to get on the bus before it was full.
reviews.title: Would stay here again!

reviews.text: Highly reccomend the sunset celebration.
reviews.title: Great stay in Key West
Good hotel, beach not great.. but best in Key West
reviews.text: My wife and I decided at the last minute to take a four-day weekend in Key West. I checked for lodging and found the only "nice" place available was the Sheraton Suites. In previous visits to Key West we stayed around Old Town, so I was a bit leery about staying so far away. However, after reading the reviews on this site we decided to go for it. BTW, locals in Key West told us that there were about 900 rooms short this season because of renovations and conversions. So, if you’re a last minute planner like us, you may be out of luck getting a choice room.
Stayed for three nights with my husband and two boys aged 8 and 6 after our road trip from Orlando down to the keys.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay in a spotlessly clean room, the pool bar was fab and the food was great we ate there on two occasions. Our boys loved the pool.
reviews.title: Clean room, bad shuttle service and review system.

reviews.text: Wasn't too impressed in Duvall street or Mallory square, far too many people in one place and its the only place in Florida I've felt a little unsafe.
reviews.title: Best Place in Key West!

reviews.text: Other than that couldn't fault the Sheraton suites and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Dont accept a room with interior courtyard(hallway)(no) view!

reviews.text: The room is clean, the hotel is about 5 mins from Duvall street and Mallory square by car. Their shuttle service is set to run ever 30 mins but people will skip in front of you, we waited for two shuttles and both times were skipped. When the driver was made aware he apologized but moved another 2 purple in front of us and told me to wait again, I filled out a comment card with my number hoping to give the manager suggestions but haven't heard from , I had to hand my card to the front desk agent which allows then to read it and possibly throw it away.
reviews.title: We would definitely stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay here.. nothing to complain about.. a very high quality hotel. Pool was just the right size, not too busy, not too many kids.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, just not a beach vacation

likes.disliked: — It was not in the town itself, had to take shuttle ......

reviews.title: Great hotel, mediocre service
reviews.text: About a 10-15 min drive from Duval Street.. actually, we are glad we stayed away from that dirty old part of town.. nice to visit.. but was very happy to head back out to the Sheraton.
Right across the street from the beach. (nice beach.. but not best waters)
reviews.title: What a great place

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, updated rooms - beds, bathrooms, etc

reviews.title: Family Friendly and CLEAN!
reviews.text: Stayed here during Spring Break - Mar 9-13. We had two suites that connected and had six people total, 2 adults and 4 kids( 18,16, 13 and 10). I did ask for an upgrade upon check-in b/c I am a Starwood member, but they could not accomodate that. Rooms were at the back end of the complex, so no view, but they were nice inside and CLEAN! We weren't in them except to sleep anyway. I was worried about the number of college spring breakers there, but never had a problem. They were all well behaved and polite. The beach across the street is great and the pool area is nice, small but we never had a problem getting a lounge chair. We ate lunch and breakfast at the hotel one time each and the food was fine. There are so many wonderful restaraunts in Key West that we ate in town for the most part. I found the staff to be very friendly. While it is not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in, it was perfect for our getaway and I would definitely stay here again.
We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and it can only be described as the perfect hotel to stay at in Key West...!
reviews.title: Worth Every Penny...

likes.liked: — Beautifully landscaped, very coutious staff, very comfortable rooms,location!
likes.disliked: — Internet access computer located right next to the bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provides complimentary shuttle service to downtown Key West approximately every hour during the day and drops you off right at Mallory Square...
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.text: The property itself is an absolute PARADISE!!! Very plush with many types of flowers, trees and bushes native to only the Keys..
reviews.title: Terrible Service
outstanding week in key west
reviews.text: You may even spot a small chameleon run across the sidewalk in front of you as you stoll through the beautifully landscaped courtyard.

reviews.title: Relaxing and Amazing Service
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites Jan. 15-20. At first we were concerned with the location being so far from Duval St. and the mixed reviews on the rooms, but it was great! We got to party as much as we wanted then come back and sleep in peace and quiet. One day my husband finally woke me up around noon! I know there are some reviews that trash the rooms, but ours was beautiful and comfortable. Being across the street from a beautiful beach was also great. Besides, the shuttle service is very helpful, it's only the really late nights you need a cab. At the front desk, Hazem is wonderful! He is the person to see for anything, even information about traveling in Europe! We enjoyed ourselves so much that my husband and his brother are going fishing in Key West soon and they will be staying at the Sheraton also.

There does not seem to be any more problems with construction and we had a relatively quiet stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very nice, clean - great bathroom. The "kitchen" area was strictly for coffee and did not have so much as a spoon but a quick trip to the supermarket solved that. You can get an ocean view but the road is between the ocean and hotel so it can be a bit noisy. We had a pool view which was great and mostly quiet except for the bar music during happy hour. All in all it was a great place to stay - but is was not worth the $469.00 per night that is charged over a holiday week. The rates are quite a bit lower at other times.
reviews.title: Very nice, but not worth the price.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding and it was worth every penny!! They upgraded us to a room with a ocean view when we said it was our wedding. So nice and helpful! Great cusotmer service and I would not want to stay anywhere else if we went back. Close to shops but not in a busy area.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: The best part was the free shuttle downtown. We took it every day. It was right on time and very, very convenient. The shuttle drivers were super. Loved Key West!!!!
reviews.title: Strong Recommendation - I will Return With Family

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites Key West Hotel during spring break and loved everything about the place. The rooms were spotless, the pool was clean, the food and drinks were good. The staff were very helpful, especially Shelly who works at the poolside bar, she's great. It's a little bit out of the way but was made close by the shuttle, which by the way, can get a bit crowded, but a taxi ride is fairly inexpensive. All in all, I highly recommend this place....it truly made our stay in the Keys a pleasure. As a matter of fact, the next time I'm in Key West, I'll be staying here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful lush grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this resort as it was Oceanside and was away from Duval. The rooms are spacious and quite comfortable. It was nice to have 2 bottles of water each day. The air conditioning worked well and was very quiet. The grounds are vey nice and the staff we crossed paths with we're very polite and friendly. The pool was nice and had lots of lounges, shade and sun. The day we were at the pool was complete pandemonium, the parents were no where to be found and a group of boys were horse playing, pushing each other into the pool with no regard for other guest. The music was so loud I thought we were at a club. It was far from relaxing. The towel service did not make any sense, you had to fill out a card with your name, room, etc. just to get the towels, then when you returned them, you had to wait for the attendant to find your card, then he ripped it up. Probably took ten minutes for this process. There isn't a lifeguard on duty and no one enforced the pool rules. There was outside drinks, alcohol, smoking and pets. I thought we were in Vegas.
reviews.title: Very nice resort

reviews.text: The hotel is near the airport but we did not hear it at all. The hotel also has windows that open which would be nice in cooler weather, it was way too hot this trip.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: I had one other observation - it isn't a complaint. We purchased the package that included breakfast, the restaurant did not open until 8:00 am. We ended up not using all of our coupons as we had excursions booked and had left the hotel prior. If you are an early rising you may want to pass on this. The included breakfast was the buffet. Standard fare kept warm. No made to order options. The restaurant does have a menu that you can order from but the included breakfast is the buffet - no other option was given. I'm glad that I didn't spend the 20 dollars each. I expected better from a Sheraton.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, far from downtown - not cheap

reviews.text: Attention to small details would have made the stay a five star. When we checked in there were fresh baked cookies and an awesome cold lime water drink. Very refreshing after a hot day out. Coffee or apples available in the morning would have been nice. I didn't want to wake my husband fiddling around to make coffee while he was still sleeping.
reviews.title: Service could be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, enjoyed the hotel, especially the bed! I would stay again as it was a nice comfortable room but the little things missing would make it not my first choice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, close to beach and airport
Not great with kids
reviews.text: My husband, three kids and I went to Key West for one week. We had never been before and wanted to go somewhere "tropical" without leaving the country. We had an "ok" time. Let me start by saying we are not hard to please...but found that the area was very overpriced and a bit run down. We stayed at the Sheraton Suites. The room was nice and big, updated inside however on the outside the hotel was lacking. Seemed a bit rundown. The pool area was a lot smaller than it seemed in the hotel photos online. The hot tub was broke for about three out of our five day trip. Best thing was the conceriege. She was great! Was very knowledgeable about all the excursions. Across from the hotel was a public beach....beware it is 30.00 for two chaises and a umbrella. Sandy area is small and no waves, however beach was quiet and relaxing, we enjoyed it. We did the Ultimate Adventure boating, which included snorkling, jet skiing, water trampoling, parasailing. It costs around 600.00 for a family of five and included breakfast and lunch. At reservations they were not very organized and we were sent to 2 different locations before we could check in for our trip. They couldn't find our reservation, so they had to re enter it which took a while. Even though I had a receipt which included a deposit. Duval street is probably great if you are there to party but with three kids in tow we didn't get much out of it. We ate at The Grande @ Key West which was very upscale but the staff seemed very snobby. Cheesburgers in Paradise was horrible, don't bother wasting your money, There was also a seafood buffett that we ate at on Duval not great. We did eat at one Italian restaurant of off Duval which was great! Best meal while we were their. All in all, I don't think Key West is geared towards families more for singles, couples. Would we go back? No, it was an "ok" vacation. Spent 6k between the airfair/hotel/food/beach/excursion. If you have a large family my advice would be to stick to the all inclusives.

My wife, daughter (4yrs), and I stayed here for three nights. The hotel was nice and clean. We liked our room very much. We had 2 TVs, a fridge, and microwave. Everything worked well. The only service that was spotty was the WIFI.
reviews.title: Great location, good services..

likes.disliked: — spotty WIFI signal in our room.

reviews.text: We loved the location right accross the road from Smather's Beach. There are vendors along the road so it was easy to find lunch at the beach.
reviews.title: Great For Family Getaway

reviews.text: There is a free shuttle into town that runs every hour. They also have a van for service to the airport. Call ahead though to make sure it is available.
reviews.title: Really nice place to stay

reviews.text: All in all, we had a great time in Key West and the hotel met all of our needs.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to Key West dozens of times, and usually stay at the Best Western Hibiscus right off Duval. Now I can say there isn't anywhere else I'd call home besides Sheraton Suites.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!! Our New Spot In Key West.

reviews.text: First great feature...Location. Directly across from Smathers Beach, all you need to do is walk across the parking lot and there you are! Great spot!
reviews.title: nice location

likes.liked: — nice location, away from hustle and bustle of duval street

reviews.text: The building itself is charming, with yellow siding, white trim, and blue shutters. Building definitely reflects Key West's personality. Great feature is that the halls are only one room deep...We had an end unit, which meant we only shared one wall with another suite. Great for Privacy. Interior hallways are nice too, with elevator options through the lobby or directly from the parking lot.
reviews.title: Beautiful oceanfront hotel

likes.disliked: — Altho it's a non-smoking hotel, there's always a rude person breaking the rules, this hotel was no exception. Not the hotels fault, of course but still annoying to me.

reviews.text: Hotel offers a great shuttle service, running throughout day and night, which is super convenient.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

likes.disliked: — Wish it was closer to Duvall Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby and grounds were clean and very well kept. Nice landscaping, great dog walking area, shady, grassy, great.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Reasonable Rates!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites in Key West from December 5-8, 2007. The hotel grounds and suite were very clean and nice. Our suite was large and the turn-down service, LCD TV, and two-person marble shower was a great addition. The room could have used some maintenance on both the shutters and bathroom hooks, however.
reviews.title: Great hotel for relaxation

likes.liked: — Great pool, near beach, very clean
likes.disliked: — Far from attractions and shuttle service does not make up for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff was friendly and efficient and the hotel has all the amenities you need - pool and hot tub with lounge chairs and towel service, bar with live entertainment on weekends, full-service restaurant (beware: breakfast can be more expensive than dinner there) and gift shop. The concierge was helpful, although a bit too bubbly and pushy with the packages for our taste.
reviews.title: Not Bad but No So Good Either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located across the street from a nice beach (Smathers), but is several miles from any other attractions. The Sheraton does provide a free shuttle service to Mallory Square, but is only runs once an hour and was too full to get on several times during our stay. We'd recommend the hotel run this service each half hour instead of each hour. An airport shuttle service would also be helpful, as it was $15 (including tip) each way for a very short taxi ride. Another disappointment in the shuttle service is that it only runs from 10-10 so any early morning tours or nightlife require a cab.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: With all of that said, we would recommend a stay at the Sheraton Suites, especially if you are there to relax and don't care to be close to the nightlife.
reviews.title: Terrific place!

reviews.text: Sheraton key west, is a very quite property, and maybe because in key west does not appear to be belonging sheraton hotel's chain.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience at Sheraton Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Key West for our anniversary, the trip started out pretty rocky, due to bad weather, plane delays, etc. Once we checked in at the Sheraton all the bad faded, the staff was wonderful and very helpful, the rooms are huge and I loved their shampoo, conditioner and lotion. They have a free shuttle to Duval Street which was great and a restaurant on the premises, which is a little expensive. There is a very nice pool area and it's right across the street from the beach.
reviews.title: Loved the Sheraton

likes.disliked: — Having to cross a pretty busy street to get to the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel across Smathers Beach in Key West.
reviews.title: Great resort hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at this Sheraton Hotel was the worse we have ever experienced. The rooms were overpriced, The staff was inexperienced both at the front desk and in the dining room and the hotel equipment was antiquated. If you wanted to use your AAA discount, the hotel staff did not register you at the hotel desk, but required you to go to their coffee bar and register online. This process took a great deal of time and was not reliable. The rooms were adequate and clean, but missing all linens needed for the sofa sleeper and they did not provide enough towels for guests. The restaurant food and service was horrible, especially at dinner and the room service menu did not properly reflect what was available from the dining room. We requested and were granted a one hour late check out time on the day of our departure, but we were locked out of our room (our key was invalidated by the hotel) before the regular check out time. When we tried to have a staff member let us in to obtain our luggage and leave the premises it took over 20 minutes. The hotel offered courtesy orange juice at the front desk, but never had cups for juice. The hotel stated they had a Starbucks Coffee Bar, but never had it staffed while we stayed there. I waited over 15 minutes and no one ever acknowledged me for any coffee service. I ordered coffee when I was seated for breakfast at the restaurant before receiving a menu and I was charged $8.00 for coffee. The only good thing we encountered while staying at this hotel was the pool area restaurant staff. This person was professional, efficient and personable. A real shining star. There is a beautiful beach directly across the street from this facility, but there are other hotels to choose from at this location.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed two nights at this wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was excellent. A large suite, with leather covered sofa, two TVs (on CRT and one LCD flat screen), small "kitchenette" corner with microwave, large refrigerator and coffee machine. Separat bathroom and toilet/shower.
reviews.title: Has FLEAS!!!

reviews.text: Not to mention the friendly and comfortable shuttle service from the hotel to down town key west (directly to Mallory square).
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.text: Finally the beach just across the A1A was large and clean.
reviews.title: Nice family resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a quiet place close to the beach, this is the hotel for you. It's literally across the street from the beach, close to the airport & on the other side of the island from downtown. The distance was not a problem for us -- we'd rather be by the beach. Shuttles run from 10 to 10 & taxis are about $12 one way downtown. You can also walk downtown (we did one day -- wear comfortable shoes), or rent bikes or scooters. The rooms were clean & comfortable and the staff was very pleasant. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay!

likes.liked: — It was across the street from the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Use the hotel concierge to book tours, and if you go to Dry Tortugas, take the Yankee Freedom. It costs a bit more than the Fast Cat, but they both take up to 100 people and the YF is much bigger! You will appreciate being able to walk around outside, especially if the waves get to be too much. Take Dramamine -- even if you think you won't get sick.
reviews.title: Relaxing and confortable Hotel !

likes.liked: — Big room, with confortable beds and plasma TV
likes.disliked: — Wireless did not work in the room

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites for a couple of days while on a vacation in Florida. Check in was very swift and efficient , the staff was friendly ( think they were either russian or polish) and our room was huge and spotless clean , with very confortable beds and a nice view.
reviews.title: The UK Touring Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was plenty of place to park our car when we arrived , and the hotel's pool & Spa was nice ... not too big , but then again, it was not so crowded while we were there ( see pictures & video )
reviews.title: Great stay, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had twice a buffet breakfast , a bit expensive , but it was damn good. We liked the bar facing the pool , it was really cool and relaxing to have a couple of drinks there while listening to live music late in the afternoon .
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The atmosphere is very relaxed with beach access just across the street. Considering how strict Florida is with pets, you can bring your pet - even to the poolside. Shuttle bus to/from Sunset beach was nice. Not too far way from Sheraton suites there's a small market and liquor store which was convenient. Our family had a relaxing time there... until we checked out and later found out that they charged $75.00 on my credit card. Why? we still don't know, but we got a refund. (with no apologies) Make sure you check your credit card bill later.
reviews.title: Good place for your fido

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Sheraton. Got this through AAA and breakfast was included every day. Staff was so helpful in getting us around and offering useful suggestions. Pool/ Bar staff was there for your every need (food/drink). We had a fantastic stay and would definitely stay here again. They do have a shuttle service. I only wish they had the shuttle running more often as it was always full.
reviews.title: Wonderful suite, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked in for a 2 night stay, disappointed with the reservation in regards to room ( no view) .Property shows so many signs of Wear and room lack details of cleaning.(examples torned drapes dirty floors and trim and doors way below industry standands could see the ouside from the cracks. Although bed was clean and comfortable. The conciegn Allison was not helpful as she destroy my dinner plans! The shuttle came late and was full.. I ad to go back to my room and call a cab(40 bucks round trip bu at least he new more about Key West then the Sheraton staff) At check in I asked about dog walking are and was told just to walk around the parking lot Wrong! They have walking areas in the courtyard Staff needs training!I expected more for the money ..next time the Hyatt!
reviews.title: Property lacks Spark!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were happy with the Sheraton Suites Key West. The hotel could do with some updatiing, but was not poor. Our only complaints would be the beds and the key cards. King beds are so worn, if you wanted to spoon, you have to climb over a hill in the middle of the bed. Key cards were very inconsistent in working to open the room doors. had front desk replace the cards once and then send a service technician up to have a look while we were out at dinner. Good thing we never really got locked out. Just had to be persistant in pushing and pulliung the card out until it was accepted. Otherwise, I would likely be writing a very different review.
reviews.title: First time in the Keys

reviews.text: Other than my husband spending 3 days in the hospital..we had a great stay here. We will be back again soon.. Great location directly across the street from Smathers Beach.. Beautiful setting & awesome view.. Management was very helpful & makes every effort to tend to the needs of their guest
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

aka: Sheraton Suites Key West Hotel Key West
description: An oasis from the everyday, the Sheraton Suites Key West is a luxurious all-suite hotel. Near Smathers Beach, Duval Street, Mallory Square, fishing, snorkeling, windsurfing, biking, or kayaking.
